for example- if i were to say "Broly is the strongest non-fused character in dragon ball" you wouldnt say "Saitama from OPM is actually the strongest"
I really love the way you do shading Sage ^^
Guessing you developed it through just trial and error? Went with what works?
Lookin good, Sage. Enjoy your evening, I'm off to work. ^^/
kinda- shading is all about how shadows fall
so there are rules to how shading technically works
unfortunately and thankfully- most people dont really understand how they work- so my stuff isnt hyper accurate but my mistakes arent noticed by most XD
i have a decent sense of how it should work
if you go back you'll see a mistake I made a lot not too long ago
depending on the lighting situation- you will often have a shadow cast on the body from the head
but a lot of the shadows drawn are just a small shadow under the head on the neck
which doesnt make much sense in many cased because of how big a human head is XD
thing is- most people dont think about shadows as much as they think about light- because it's light- you see it more XD
so missplaced or overblown highlights are a lot more obvious than shading
for hair though- what im doing now is a quick way to do hair- yet its not as fast as some i like the look
together with the blend effect (is it a brush? i dunno...) it looks really good
the idea is to use these strokes to break up the hair so it looks like it can be more like strands
then use the soft erase to add the more natural light on the hair
So that's how you do hair XD
i do it other ways too
but this is a relatively fast way that works and has a good look to it
and speed matters when you are doing 4 comics a week
brb gonna check to see if someone plugged in a power tool or something crazy
so yeah- i was gonna say earlier- the more i interact with people the more I think the ability to come up with stories is more rare than people who can draw.
yeah- I thought it was the opposite before but- yeah i keep meeting people who claim to be writers because they cant draw and well- they cant write either
In my humble experience creativity and especially coming up with ideas fast is a rare feature these days. not that people can't do it - they never learned how to
I find it very easy to create characters and stories, but i still see some veteran artist struggling with it
Yeah. Sad to say all my ideas tend to be rather derivative
depends what you are doing. I'm an engineer so everything i can reuse from somewhere else, i don't have to come up with
of course this thought is just a change in my current anecdotal opinion
but yeah using music and graphic design as a kind of counterbalance coming up with something that's not derivative is still dificult if i don't go at it the right way which i mostly don't xD
also - its fine to come up with derivative ideas and concepts so long as when you plan to use them in something you diversify it enough to make it your own.
the remix I'm doing right now is, well a remix, also the second part is kinda similar to a certain hardwell track
Don't really know if my ideas are like that. I leave that up to others
something people keep thinking that really bugs me is that if something is similar to something that was done before- then it's not as good or it's just a copy
it bothers me a lot because people will keep deconstructing stuff down further and further till you are looking at basic concepts and use that as proof
"Ha, so your character is a hero? Let me guess- they go  on the heroes journey? So predictable!"
There are only so many stories you can tell
"ha, your character learned from making a mistake? How predictable! So unoriginal!"
Coming up with something new in this context that actually works and is not just new for the sake of being something new is hard to impossible
There is a genre called no input music
i disagree with the "there are only so many stories you can tell"
it only works when you deconstruct something to its base values
"man vs man, Man vs Nature, Man vs Self"
man in those does not refer to a male nor does it refer to a human
"relative being" might be a good way to put it
That's kinda what I was doing yeah. Which isn't the right way to go about it ^^;
So yeah I agree with you Sage and Teapot
"There is an evil demon atop the mountain, you can make hundreds of "hero" characters to go fight it and each one can be interesting and different
and in anime half of those it turns out the evil demon is a hot chick
why do i suddenly think of Deadpool now?
